newsitem.title: INDIA: India I-Sec sees 13.5 pct 97 govt stock rollover.
newsitem.headline: India I-Sec sees 13.5 pct 97 govt stock rollover.

text.p: India's ICICI Securities and Finance Company (I-Sec) said Monday it expected the government to roll over its 13.5 percent 1997 bond maturing in September.
The bond was issued in three tranches on September 1, 1995, October 14, 1995 and March 1, 1996 for amounts of 20 billion rupees, 30 billion rupees and 20 billion rupees respectively.
"The last issue saw a large devolvement with only 1.69 billion being subscribed to by the market," it said in its fortnightly debt market update released on Monday.

"Though the government may be in a position to finance the redemption, an inflow of the magnitude of 51.69 billion rupees would push down call rates to below one percent and create a spurt in money supply," the report said.
"Hence, it is almost certain that the RBI will issue fresh stock to coincide with this maturity," it said.
"However, a 30 billion rupees issue would still imply a net inflow of 22 billion rupees, equivalent in impact to a 0.5 percentage point reduction in CRR (cash reserve ratio)," it said.
